Topic.Title: The Quest to find The Dark Hills

Posts.EditableText:
Hey,

 So I finally decided to upload 'The Quest to find The Dark Hills' to textadventures.co.uk but every time I try to log in it says server not found. Anyone know why that is, or how it can be fixed?

 Thanks,
Slackers Inc.

**Edit**
 So now it no longer says 'server not found' and I can log in, but when I click 'submit a game' and click upload, nothing seems to happen. It's like it doesn't like my game or something.

**Edit**
 It took a few modifications to the game, but I finally got it uploaded. Hope you guys enjoy playing it!

Posts.EditableText:
I'm not sure if you'll get this Thomas, but you posted...
[quote:udsdjnle]I am stuck, have no idea what to do after getting the final clue at the second church. How do I proceed?

I will not post a review before I have completed the game, but so far I am pretty impressed. Writing is elaborate and of good quality, except for some typos (alter). Also you are missing some objects, like the bed in your bedroom. Some scenery object descriptions would have been nice, like the mosaic in the church.

However it is very intuitive and therefore very playable. Typing "cut down eastern tree" did exactly that, which is only a good thing. To many text adventures are plagued by the dreaded "guess the verb" disease. [/quote:udsdjnle]
... on textadventures.co.uk. 

 Unfortunately, I'm having trouble logging in again. Every time I've tried I get the stupid 'server not found' message and in the address bar it says 'http://login.php/'. Hopefully I'll be able to log in soon and respond, but I thought I'd answer it here as well so that everyone knows.

 I know it's a bit hard to work out, but the final clue should say..

"Up 'til now you've topped the rest
Over, above and beyond the best
Sky's the limit, so you shall rise
Into the heavens before our eyes."
 
You have to 'levitate' in order to get the next map. Once you have the map it will unlock the North exit, and you can continue. If you'd like, after levitating you can type 'land' and it will print 'You slowly descend back down to the ground.' but you don't need to because the exit will already be unlocked.
